page.title: 13Schools
page.content: Salesian School, a comprehensive, in Chertsey has nearly 1000 pupils, over two sites. A staff of 61 includes priests and nuns. Being a Catholic school it has a large catchment area. The Meads Comprehensive School is closing after 20 years. It is merging with St. Pauls at Addlestone to form Abbeylands from September 1985. St. Georges is a private Catholic boarding and day school. There are 3 middle schools which include their own first school, St. Nicholas C/E, Pyrcroft and Stepgates. St. Thomas the Apostle and Our Lady's First schools are R.C. Two special schools are Claybourne for educationallly sub-normal children and Manor Mead for children with brain and speech problems.
